headline: Finland's Kone picks CFO from Microsoft's phones unit
description: Kone Oyj <KNEBV.HE> : says appoints Ilkka Hara as CFO and member of the executive board . appointment follows Eriikka Soderstrom's decision to leave Kone at the end of July . Hara joins Kone from Microsoft, where he has served as General Manager and CFO for the Phones Business, previous roles at Nokia Further company coverage: [KNEBV.HE] (Helsinki Newsroom) ((news@reuters.fi; +358 9 6805 0244;)).

headline: Microsoft sees $150 mln of cost synergies annually by 2018 from LinkedIn deal
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>: Sees $150 mln of cost synergies annually by 2018 from LinkedIn deal - SEC filing . Under agreement, LinkedIn may not solicit competing proposals or participate in any discussions or negotiations regarding alternative deals Further company coverage: [MSFT.O] (Bengaluru Newsroom: +1-646-223-8780).

headline: S&P says LinkedIn unsolicited ratings placed on creditwatch positive on acquisition by Microsoft
description: S&P Global Ratings : Linkedin corp. Unsolicited ratings placed on creditwatch positive on acquisition by microsoft .Creditwatch placement is based linkedin's agreement to be acquired by microsoft, an entity with a stronger credit profile.

headline: S&P says Microsoft 'AAA/A-1+' ratings affirmed on its plan to acquire LinkedIn, outlook stable
description: S&P Global Ratings : Microsoft 'aaa/a-1+' ratings affirmed on its plan to acquire linkedin for $26.2 billion; outlook stable . Stable outlook reflects belief that microsoft will remain committed to maintaining high credit quality by sustaining its net cash position .Rating affirmation on microsoft reflects view that acquisition of linkedin adds to its diversified product portfolio, despite linkedin's relatively small revenue base.

headline: Moody's reviews Microsoft's AAA rating for downgrade
description: Moody's: Moody's reviews Microsoft's AAA rating for downgrade following announced acquisition of LinkedIn . Review will focus on strategic fit, monetization opportunities of LinkedIn with Microsoft's software offerings . Review to also consider Microsoft's plan to reduce, sustain gross leverage at or below 1.5 times while maintaining significant net cash position .Potential downgrade of Microsoft would likely be limited to one notch.

headline: Fitch places Microsoft's 'AA+' on Watch Negative after LinkedIn deal announcement
description: Fitch: Places Microsoft's 'AA+' on watch negative following LinkedIn acquisition announcement . Expects acquisition of LinkedIn will accelerate top line growth through at least intermediate term . Rating watch negative reflects expectation for structurally higher leverage, given Microsoft's intention to fund deal primarily with new debt .Sees supplemental adjusted net leverage to approach 1.5x, pro forma for deal, expectations Microsoft will continue borrowing to fund returns.

headline: Microsoft sets September dividend of $0.36 per share
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> : Microsoft announces quarterly dividend .Sets September dividend of $0.36 per share.

headline: Moody's changes outlook on Microsoft to negative
description: Moody's On Microsoft : Moody's confirms Microsoft's Aaa senior unsecured rating; outlook changed to negative . Expects Microsoft will generate profitability with high-30% ebitda margins, free cash flow generation in excess of $13 billion annually .Effective integration of LinkedIn, could provide benefits to ecosystem surrounding Microsoft's cloud based services platform.

headline: Moody's rates Microsoft's new senior notes at AAA
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> :Moody's rates Microsoft's new senior notes at AAA.

headline: Moody's rates Microsoft's new senior notes at Aaa
description: Moody's : Ratings reflects expectations that microsoft's business model will remain exceptionally robust as it transitions from on premise licensing . Believes microsoft may also raise debt to support future dividend, share buybacks such that gross debt could exceed $90 billion in fiscal 2017 . Expects microsoft will fund pending linkedin acquisition entirely with debt, leading to microsoft's gross adjusted debt to ebitda above 2x .Moody's rates microsoft's new senior notes at aaa.

headline: Fitch rates Microsoft's senior unsecured notes 'AA+'
description: Fitch on Microsoft's senior unsecured notes - : Fitch rates Microsoft's senior unsecured notes 'AA+'; Long term ratings on negative watch .Rating reflects expectation for structurally higher leverage, given company's intention to fund LinkedIn deal primarily with new debt.

headline: Microsoft announces quarterly dividend increase and share repurchase program
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> : Microsoft announces quarterly dividend increase and share repurchase program . Increases quarterly dividend by 8 percent to $0.39 per share . Says reaffirmed that it is on track to complete its current $40 billion stock repurchase program by December 31, 2016 .Says approved a new share repurchase program authorizing up to $40 billion in share repurchase.

headline: Microsoft reports Q1 GAAP earnings of $0.60 per share
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>: Quarterly diluted earnings per share was $0.60 GAAP, and $0.76 non-GAAP . Quarterly Windows OEM revenue was flat year-over-year . Quarterly revenue was $20.5 billion GAAP, and $22.3 billion non-GAAP . Q1 earnings per share view $0.68, revenue view $21.71 billion -- Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S . Quarterly search advertising revenue excluding traffic acquisition costs grew 9 percent (up 10% in constant currency) . Quarterly revenue in more personal computing declined 2 percent (down 1 percent in constant currency) to $9.3 billion . Quarterly phone revenue declined 72 percent (down 71% in constant currency) . Quarterly gaming revenue declined 5 percent (down 4% in constant currency) . Quarterly revenue in productivity and business processes grew 6 percent (up 8 percent in constant currency) to $6.7 billion . Quarterly Windows commercial products and cloud services revenue was flat year-over-year (up 2 percent in constant currency) . Quarterly revenue in Intelligent Cloud grew 8 percent (up 10 percent in constant currency) to $6.4 billion . Quarterly Office commercial products and cloud services revenue grew 5 percent (up 8 percent in constant currency) . Quarterly server products and cloud services revenue increased 11 percent (up 13 percent in constant currency) . Quarterly Office consumer products and cloud services revenue grew 8 percent (up 8 percent in constant currency).

headline: U.S. CPSC says battery chargers for XBOX ONE video game controllers recalled by Performance Designed Products
description: U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission: Battery chargers for XBOX ONE video game controllers recalled by performance designed products due to burn hazard . Recalled about 121,000 units in U.S. . No injuries have been reported . Received 24 reports of chargers overheating, including 6 reports of chargers emitting burning odor, relating to recall .Recall involves Energizer XBOX ONE 2X smart chargers used to charge XBOX ONE video game controllers.

headline: Microsoft appoints Reid Hoffman to its board effective immediately
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>: Microsoft announces addition to board and quarterly dividend . Sets quarterly dividend of $0.39per share . Appointment of Reid Hoffman, co-founder of Linkedin, to its board of directors effective immediately . Microsoft - appointment of Reid Hoffman, co-founder of Linkedin, to its board of directors effective immediately .Microsoft - adding Hoffman to board increases Microsoft's board to 12 members.

headline: Microsoft received 25,837 legal requests for customer info in latter half of 2016
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>: Says during the latter half of 2016, received a total number of 25,837 legal requests for customer information from law enforcement agencies . Says total number of requests from law enforcement for 2016 to 61,409, which is a decrease from 2015, when requests totaled 74,311 . Says 71 percent of law enforcement demands received in latter half of 2016 came from handful of countries, led by U.S., UK, France and Germany .Says got 1,000-1,499 foreign intelligence surveillance act orders seeking content disclosures affecting 12,000-12,499 accounts for July-Dec 2016 period.

description: Microsoft Corp CFO Hood : In q4 we did see additional softness in brazil, middle east, and Africa, which were impacted by macroeconomic headwinds- Conf call . "we expect volatility as we saw in both q3 and q4 this year to continue in next fiscal year"- Conf call . "expect the commercial cloud gross margin percentage and dollars to materially improve next fiscal year"- Conf call . "also anticipate our cloud capital expenditure growth curve will slow"- Conf call . "now expect our full year operating expense will be $31.1 billion to $31.4 billion "- Conf call . " based on current currency rates, forecasted geographic mix of revenue, we expect 2 points of negative impact on total revenue in q1"- Conf call . " for q1 expect commercial unearned revenue be within the range of $21.8 billion to $22 billion"- Conf call . " for q1 in productivity and business process, we expect revenue to be $6.4 billion to $6.6 billion"- Conf call . " for q1 for intelligent cloud we expect revenue between $6.1 billion and $6.3 billion "- Conf call . " for q1 anticipate that our OEM revenue will be more in line with overall pc market trends"- Conf call . " for q1 expect operating expenses between $7.35 billion and $7.45 billion"- Conf call . CEO-"with more than $12 billion in commercial cloud annualized revenue run rate, we are on track to achieve our goal of $20 billion in fiscal year 2018 " - Conf call.

headline: Microsoft reports quarterly GAAP earnings per share $0.39
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>: Quarterly diluted earnings per share was $0.39 GAAP, and $0.69 non-GAAP . Quarterly revenue in productivity and business processes grew 5 percent (up 8 percent in constant currency) to $7.0 billion . Q4 GAAP revenue $20.6 billion versus $22.18 billion last year . Quarterly Windows OEM non-pro revenue grew 27 percent (up 27 percent in constant currency) . Q4 non-GAAP revenue $22.6 billion versus $22.18 billion last year . Q4 earnings per share view $0.58, revenue view $22.15 billion -- Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S . Quarterly revenue in intelligent cloud grew 7 percent (up 10 percent in constant currency) to $6.7 billion . Quarterly server products and cloud services revenue increased 5 percent . Quarterly office commercial products and cloud services revenue grew 5 percent (up 9 percent in constant currency) . Quarterly phone revenue declined 71 percent (down 70 percent in constant currency) . Quarterly Azure revenue grew 102 percent . Quarterly revenue in more personal computing declined 4 percent (down 2 percent in constant currency) to $8.9 billion . Quarterly Xbox Live monthly active users grew 33 percent year-over-year to 49 million . Quarterly surface revenue increased 9 percent (up 9 percent in constant currency) . Microsoft cloud seeing "significant customer momentum" . Quarterly search advertising revenue excluding traffic acquisition costs grew 16 percent (up 17 percent in constant currency).

Microsoft corp says about 2,850 roles globally will be reduced during the year as an extension of the earlier plan .Microsoft corp says the reduction is in addition to the elimination of 1,850 positions announced in may 2016.

headline: Microsoft reports quarterly GAAP earnings $0.66 per share
description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> : Microsoft reports record second-quarter . Quarterly revenue was $24.1 billion GAAP, and $26.1 billion non-GAAP . Quarterly diluted earnings per share was $0.66 GAAP, and $0.83 non-GAAP . Quarterly revenue in productivity and business processes was $7.4 billion and increased 10% (up 12% in constant currency) . Q2 earnings per share view $0.79, revenue view $25.30 billion -- Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S . Quarterly office commercial products and cloud services revenue increased 5% (up 7% in constant currency) . Quarterly revenue in intelligent cloud was $6.9 billion and increased 8% (up 10% in constant currency) . Quarterly office 365 commercial revenue growth of 47% (up 49% in constant currency) . Quarterly revenue in more personal computing was $11.8 billion and decreased 5% . Quarterly office consumer products and cloud services revenue increased 22% (up 21% in constant currency) . Quarterly search advertising revenue excluding traffic acquisition costs increased 10% (up 11% in constant currency) . Quarterly office 365 consumer subscribers increased to 24.9 million . Quarterly server products and cloud services revenue increased 12% (up 14% in constant currency) driven by double-digit annuity revenue growth . Quarterly gaming revenue decreased 3% (down 1% in constant currency) . Quarterly windows OEM revenue increased 5% (up 5% in constant currency).

headline: Microsoft To Acquire GitHub For $7.5 Billion
description: June 4 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT TO ACQUIRE GITHUB FOR $7.5 BILLION.MICROSOFT - UNDER TERMS OF AGREEMENT, MICROSOFT WILL ACQUIRE GITHUB FOR $7.5 BILLION IN MICROSOFT STOCK.MICROSOFT - GITHUB WILL RETAIN ITS DEVELOPER-FIRST ETHOS AND WILL OPERATE INDEPENDENTLY.MICROSOFT -  MICROSOFT CORPORATE VICE PRESIDENT NAT FRIEDMAN, FOUNDER OF XAMARIN AND AN OPEN SOURCE VETERAN, WILL ASSUME ROLE OF GITHUB CEO.MICROSOFT - UPON CLOSING, MICROSOFT EXPECTS GITHUB'S FINANCIALS TO BE REPORTED AS PART OF INTELLIGENT CLOUD SEGMENT.MICROSOFT - CO EXPECTS DEAL WILL BE ACCRETIVE TO OPERATING INCOME IN FISCAL YEAR 2020 ON NON-GAAP BASIS.MICROSOFT -  EXPECTS ACQUISITION WILL HAVE MINIMAL DILUTION OF LESS THAN 1 PERCENT TO EARNINGS PER SHARE IN FISCAL YEARS 2019 AND 2020 ON A NON-GAAP BASIS.MICROSOFT - CO WILL USE PORTION OF REMAINING ABOUT $30 BILLION OF CURRENT SHARE REPURCHASE AUTHORIZATION FOR PURCHASE.MICROSOFT-INCREMENTAL SHARE BUYBACK, BEYOND  RECENT HISTORICAL QUARTERLY PACE EXPECTED TO OFFSET STOCK CONSIDERATION PAID WITHIN 6 MONTHS AFTER CLOSING.MICROSOFT - GITHUB'S CURRENT CEO, CHRIS WANSTRATH, TO BECOME MICROSOFT TECHNICAL FELLOW TO WORK ON STRATEGIC SOFTWARE INITIATIVES.

description: Jan 30 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::Q2 DILUTED EARNINGS PER SHARE WAS $1.08 GAAP AND $1.10 NON-GAAP.QTRLY REVENUE WAS $32.5 BILLION AND INCREASED 12%.Q2 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $1.09, REVENUE VIEW $32.51 BILLION -- REFINITIV IBES DATA.MICROSOFT RETURNED $9.6 BILLION TO SHAREHOLDERS IN FORM OF SHARE REPURCHASES AND DIVIDENDS IN Q2 OF FISCAL YEAR 2019.QTRLY REVENUE IN INTELLIGENT CLOUD WAS $9.4 BILLION AND INCREASED 20%.QTRLY  SERVER PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 24%.QTRLY REVENUE IN PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES WAS $10.1 BILLION AND INCREASED 13%.INCREASE IN QTRLY SERVER PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE WAS DRIVEN BY AZURE REVENUE GROWTH OF 76 PERCENT.GAAP RESULTS INCLUDE NET CHARGES RELATED TO TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT (TCJA) OF $157 MILLION FOR Q2.QTRLY OFFICE COMMERCIAL PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 11%.QTRLY REVENUE IN MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING WAS $13.0 BILLION AND INCREASED 7% (UP 7% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).QTRLY WINDOWS OEM REVENUE DECLINED 5% (DOWN 5% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).QTRLY OFFICE COMMERCIAL PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASE DRIVEN BY OFFICE 365 COMMERCIAL REVENUE GROWTH OF 34%.QTRLY LINKEDIN REVENUE INCREASED 29%.QTRLY GAMING REVENUE INCREASED 8% (UP 9% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY) WITH XBOX SOFTWARE & SERVICES REVENUE GROWTH OF 31% (UP 32% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).QTRLY GAAP RESULTS INCLUDE NET CHARGES RELATED TO TCJA OF $157 MILLION FOR Q2 OF FISCAL YEAR 2019 AND $13.8 BILLION FOR Q2 OF FISCAL YEAR 2018.

headline: Microsoft to terminate Channel Partner Agreement With Eoh Mthombo
description: Feb 12 (Reuters) - Eoh Holdings Ltd <EOHJ.J>::MICROSOFT CHANNEL PARTNER AGREEMENT.MICROSOFT HAS GIVEN NOTICE OF ITS INTENTION TO TERMINATE ITS CHANNEL PARTNER AGREEMENT WITH EOH MTHOMBO.EOH HAS NOT BEEN PROVIDED WITH ANY REASON FOR NOTICE OF TERMINATION..- EFFECT OF THE TERMINATION NOTICE WILL BE THAT EOH MTHOMBO WILL NO LONGER BE DIRECT RESELLER OF MICROSOFT LICENCES.INITIATED PLANS TO ENSURE "MINIMAL DISRUPTION TO CUSTOMERS" AND LIMIT IMPACT ON BUSINESS FROM MICROSOFT AGREEMENT TERMINATION.EFFECT OF THE TERMINATION NOTICE WILL ALSO BE A PROFIT IMPACT OF APPROXIMATELY R10MILLION IN CURRENT FINANCIAL YEAR.CO'S CEO STEPHEN VAN COLLER ACTIVELY ENGAGING MICROSOFT TO "BETTER UNDERSTAND AND RESOLVE THIS MATTER AS SOON AS PRACTICALLY POSSIBLE".

headline: Eoh Says Co Is No Longer A Reseller Of Microsoft Software Licences
description: March 25 (Reuters) - Eoh Holdings Ltd <EOHJ.J>::UPDATE ON THE MICROSOFT RELATIONSHIP."DISAPPOINTED AT UNILATERAL MANNER IN WHICH MICROSOFT HAS TERMINATED RELATIONSHIP".FURTHER MEETINGS, CORRESPONDENCE BETWEEN CO'S SENIOR EXECUTIVES & LOCAL MICROSOFT LEADERSHIP ONGOING TO DISCUSS IMPACT OF TERMINATIONS .MICROSOFT'S LOCAL OFFICE ADVISED CO THEY INITIATED INVESTIGATIONS INTO CONTRACTS INVOLVING MICROSOFT AND GOVERNMENT WHICH MAY TAKE 6-12 MTHS TO CONCLUDE.FURTHER MEETINGS, TALKS BETWEEN EOH SENIOR EXECUTIVES & LOCAL MICROSOFT LEADERSHIP ONGOING TO SEEK SOLUTION TO LIMIT IMPACT ON CUSTOMERS.ASSESSING AND DISCUSSING VARIOUS ALTERNATIVES TO ENSURE LONG-TERM CONTINUITY OF SERVICE TO ALL CUSTOMERS.MICROSOFT ADVISED THEY WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO ENTER DISCUSSIONS REGARDING RE-INSTATEMENT OF PARTNERSHIP UNTIL CONCLUDED INVESTIGATIONS.EOH IS NO LONGER A RESELLER OF MICROSOFT SOFTWARE LICENCES.MANY EOH GROUP COS RECEIVED 30-DAY NOTICE PERIOD OF MICROSOFT IRELAND'S INTENTION TO TERMINATE MICROSOFT PARTNER NETWORK AGREEMENT .

headline: Microsoft Reports Q3 Diluted EPS Of $1.14
description: April 24 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT REPORTS RECORD THIRD-QUARTER.MICROSOFT QTRLY REVENUE WAS $30.6 BILLION AND INCREASED 14%.MICROSOFT QTRLY DILUTED EARNINGS PER SHARE WAS $1.14 AND INCREASED 20%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY REVENUE IN PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES WAS $10.2 BILLION AND INCREASED 14%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY OFFICE COMMERCIAL PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 12%.Q3 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $1.00, REVENUE VIEW $29.84 BILLION -- REFINITIV IBES DATA.MICROSOFT - QTRLY LINKEDIN REVENUE INCREASED 27%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY SERVER PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 27% (UP 29% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY) DRIVEN BY AZURE REVENUE GROWTH OF 73%.MICROSOFT QTRLY REVENUE IN MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING WAS $10.7 BILLION AND INCREASED 8% (UP 9% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).MICROSOFT - MICROSOFT RETURNED $7.4 BILLION TO SHAREHOLDERS IN FORM OF SHARE REPURCHASES AND DIVIDENDS IN Q3 OF FISCAL YEAR 2019.MICROSOFT QTRLY WINDOWS OEM REVENUE INCREASED 9% (UP 9% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).MICROSOFT - QTRLY REVENUE IN INTELLIGENT CLOUD WAS $9.7 BILLION AND INCREASED 22%.

headline: Microsoft Sees Q4 Productivity And Business Processes Revenue Of $10.55- $10.75 Bln
description: April 24 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT SEES Q4 PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES REVENUE OF $10.55 BILLION- $10.75 BILLION.MICROSOFT SEES Q4 INTELLIGENT CLOUD REVENUE OF $10.85 BILLION TO $11.05 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q4 MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING REVENUE OF $10.80 BILLION - $11.10 BILLION.MICROSOFT SEES DECREASE TO Q4 TOTAL REVENUE GROWTH OF ABOUT 2 POINTS FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.MICROSOFT SEES DECREASE TO Q4 COGS AND OPEX GROWTH OF ABOUT 1 POINT FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.MICROSOFT - SEES Q4 OPERATING EXPENSES OF $10.70 BILLION - $10.80 BILLION.

headline: Microsoft Sees Q1 Intelligent Cloud Revenue $10.30 Bln To $10.50 Bln
description: July 18 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::SEES Q1 PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES REVENUE $10.70 BILLION TO $10.90 BILLION.SEES Q1 INTELLIGENT CLOUD REVENUE $10.30 BILLION TO $10.50 BILLION.SEES DECREASE TO FY 2020 REVENUE GROWTH OF ABOUT 1 POINT FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.SEES Q1 MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING REVENUE $10.70 BILLION TO $11.00 BILLION.SEES DECREASE TO FY 2020 COGS GROWTH OF ABOUT 1 POINT FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.SEES Q1 OPERATING EXPENSES $10.10 BILLION TO $10.20 BILLION.SEES NO IMPACT TO FY 2020 OPEX GROWTH FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.SEES FY 2020 OPERATING EXPENSES GROWTH OF 11% TO 12% Y-O-Y.FOR FY 2020, "WE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE OUR INVESTMENT IN CAPITAL EXPENDITURES TO MEET THE GROWING DEMAND FOR OUR CLOUD SERVICES".

headline: Microsoft Q4 Diluted Earnings Per Share Was $1.71 GAAP And $1.37 Non-GAAP
description: July 18 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::QTRLY REVENUE WAS $33.7 BILLION AND INCREASED 12%.QTRLY DILUTED EARNINGS PER SHARE WAS $1.71 GAAP AND $1.37 NON-GAAP.GAAP RESULTS INCLUDE A NET INCOME TAX BENEFIT OF $2.6 BILLION FOR THE FOURTH QUARTER.Q4 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $1.21, REVENUE VIEW $32.77 BILLION -- REFINITIV IBES DATA.QTRLY REVENUE IN INTELLIGENT CLOUD WAS $11.4 BILLION AND INCREASED 19%.QTRLY REVENUE IN PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES WAS $11.0 BILLION AND INCREASED 14% (UP 17% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).QTRLY REVENUE IN MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING WAS $11.3 BILLION AND INCREASED 4%.QTRLY WINDOWS OEM REVENUE INCREASED 9%.QTRLY  SERVER PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 22% DRIVEN BY AZURE REVENUE GROWTH OF 64%.QTRLY OFFICE COMMERCIAL PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 14% (UP 16% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).RETURNED $7.7 BILLION TO SHAREHOLDERS IN THE FORM OF SHARE REPURCHASES AND DIVIDENDS IN Q4 FISCAL YEAR 2019.QTRLY LINKEDIN REVENUE INCREASED 25% (UP 28% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).QTRLY GAMING REVENUE DECLINED 10% WITH XBOX SOFTWARE AND SERVICES REVENUE DOWN 3%.

headline: Microsoft - Sees Q2 FY20 Productivity & Business Processes Rev $11.3 Bln To $11.5 Bln
description: Oct 23 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT -SEES Q2 FY2020 PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES REVENUE OF $11.3 BILLION TO $11.5 BILLION.MICROSOFT SEES Q2 INTELLIGENT CLOUD REVENUE OF $11.25 TO $11.45 BILLION.MICROSOFT -SEES Q2 FY2020 MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING REVENUE OF $12.6 BILLION TO $13.0 BILLION.MICROSOFT - FULL YEAR 2020 OPERATING MARGIN EXPECTED TO BE UP SLIGHTLY YEAR OVER YEAR.MICROSOFT -SEES Q2 FY2020 OPERATING EXPENSES OF $10.8 BILLION TO $10.9 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES DECREASE TO Q2 FY 2020 TOTAL REVENUE GROWTH OF ABOUT 1 POINT FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.MICROSOFT - SEES DECREASE TO FY 2020 REVENUE GROWTH OF ABOUT 1 POINT FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.MICROSOFT -SEES Q2 FY 2020 COGS OF $12.45 BILLION TO $12.65 BILLION.

headline: Microsoft Sees Double-Digit Revenue And Operating Income Growth In FY 2020
description: Oct 23 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT CFO- FOR PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES WE EXPECT Q2 REVENUE BETWEEN $11.3 BILLION AND $11.5 BILLION.MICROSOFT CFO- FOR INTELLIGENT CLOUD WE EXPECT Q2 REVENUE BETWEEN $11.25 BILLION AND $11.45 BILLION.MICROSOFT CFO-  IN AZURE, WE EXPECT CONTINUED STRONG GROWTH IN OUR CONSUMPTION-BASED BUSINESS AND MODERATING GROWTH IN OUR PER USER BUSINESS IN Q2.MICROSOFT CFO-  IN MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING, WE EXPECT Q2 REVENUE BETWEEN $12.6 BILLION AND $13 BILLION.MICROSOFT CFO-  EXPECT Q2 COGS OF $12.45 BILLION TO $12.65 BILLION AND OPERATING EXPENSES OF $10.8 BILLION TO $10.9 BILLION.MICROSOFT- EXPECTS  DOUBLE-DIGIT REVENUE AND OPERATING INCOME GROWTH IN FULL YEAR FISCAL 2020 - CONF CALL.MICROSOFT- NOW EXPECT FISCAL 2020 FY OPERATING MARGINS TO BE UP SLIGHTLY YEAR-OVER-YEAR.MICROSOFT CORP SAW 'MATERIAL GROWTH' IN NUMBER OF $10M AND ABOVE AZURE CLOUD COMPUTING CONTRACTS - CFO ON CONF CALL.

headline: Rhipe Unit Appointed By Microsoft Japan As Indirect Cloud Solutions Provider
description: Oct 30 (Reuters) - Rhipe Ltd <RHP.AX>::RHIPE JAPAN APPOINTED BY MICROSOFT JAPAN AS AN INDIRECT CLOUD SOLUTIONS PROVIDER.EXPECTS TO INVEST ABOUT AUD $3 MLN IN RHIPE JAPAN JOINT VENTURE DURING 2020 FINANCIAL YEAR.MAINTAINS ITS FY20 OPERATING PROFIT GUIDANCE OF AUD $16 MILLION EXCLUDING, OR $13 MILLION INCLUDING REQUIRED INVESTMENT FOR RHIPE JAPAN.

headline: Nokia And Microsoft Announce Strategic Collaboration
description: Nov 5 (Reuters) - Nokia Oyj <NOKIA.HE>::MICROSOFT AND NOKIA COLLABORATE TO ACCELERATE DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION AND INDUSTRY 4.0 FOR COMMUNICATIONS SERVICE PROVIDERS AND ENTERPRISES.COLLABORATION TO ACCELERATE TRANSFORMATION AND INNOVATION ACROSS INDUSTRIES WITH CLOUD, ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE AND INTERNET OF THINGS.

headline: OMV Partners With Microsoft To Accelerate Its Digitalization Strategy
description: Dec 3 (Reuters) - OMV AG <OMVV.VI>::OMV PARTNERS WITH MICROSOFT TO ACCELERATE ITS DIGITALIZATION STRATEGY.OMV WILL IMPLEMENT MICROSOFT CLOUD TECHNOLOGIES SUCH AS THE HYBRID CLOUD PLATFORM AZURE, WHICH WILL ALLOW SCALABILITY AND UBIQUITY IN BOTH DATA STORAGE AND PROCESSING.

headline: Microsoft Sees Q3 Intelligent Cloud Revenue $11.85 Billion To $12.05 Billion
description: Jan 29 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT - SEES Q3 INTELLIGENT CLOUD REVENUE $11.85 BILLION TO $12.05 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q3 COGS OF $11.05 BILLION TO $11.25 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q3 FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT TO DECREASE REVENUE AT CO, INDIVIDUAL SEGMENT LEVEL BY ABOUT 1 POINT.MICROSOFT - SEES FY20 OPERATING EXPENSES TO GROW 10% TO 11% YOY.MICROSOFT - IN Q3, SEES NO FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT ON COGS AND OPEX GROWTH.MICROSOFT - SEES FY20 OPERATING MARGIN TO BE UP ABOUT 2 POINTS.MICROSOFT - SEES Q3 OPERATING EXPENSES OF $11.2 BILLION TO $11.3 BILLION.

headline: Microsoft Says Not Expecting To Meet More Personal Computing Segment Guidance For Third Quarter
description: Feb 26 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT UPDATE ON Q3 FY20 GUIDANCE.MICROSOFT - FOR Q3 OF FISCAL YEAR 2020, WE DO NOT EXPECT TO MEET MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING SEGMENT GUIDANCE.MICROSOFT - ALL OTHER COMPONENTS OF OUR Q3 GUIDANCE REMAIN UNCHANGED.MICROSOFT - WINDOWS OEM AND SURFACE ARE MORE NEGATIVELY IMPACTED THAN PREVIOUSLY ANTICIPATED.MICROSOFT- ALTHOUGH SEE WINDOWS DEMAND IN LINE WITH EXPECTATIONS, SUPPLY CHAIN RETURNING TO NORMAL OPERATIONS AT SLOWER PACE THAN EXPECTED DURING Q2 EARNINGS CALL.

headline: Microsoft Sees Q4 More Personal Computing Rev Of $11.3 Bln To $11.7 Bln
description: April 29 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT - SEES MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING Q4 REVENUE OF $11.3 BILLION TO $11.7 BILLION.MICROSOFT SEES Q4 INTELLIGENT CLOUD REVENUE $12.9 BILLION TO $13.15 BILLION.MICROSOFT SEES Q4 PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES REVENUE $11.65 BILLION TO $11.95 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q4 FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT OF DECREASE TO TOTAL REVENUE GROWTH OF ABOUT 2 POINTS.MICROSOFT - SEES Q4 OPERATING EXPENSES OF $11.8 BILLION TO $11.9 BILLION.

headline: Microsoft Q3 Earnings Per Share Of $1.40
description: April 29 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::QUARTERLY DILUTED EARNINGS PER SHARE WAS $1.40.QUARTERLY REVENUE WAS $35.0 BILLION AND INCREASED 15%.MICROSOFT - COVID-19 HAD MINIMAL NET IMPACT ON TOTAL COMPANY REVENUE IN QUARTER.QUARTERLY REVENUE IN PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES WAS $11.7 BILLION AND INCREASED 15%.SAYS IN FINAL WEEKS OF QUARTER, THERE WAS A SLOWDOWN IN TRANSACTIONAL LICENSING, PARTICULARLY IN SMALL AND MEDIUM BUSINESSES.QUARTERLY OFFICE COMMERCIAL PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 13%.SAYS IN FINAL WEEKS OF QUARTER THERE WAS A REDUCTION IN ADVERTISING SPEND IN LINKEDIN..SAYS IN PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES AND INTELLIGENT CLOUD SEGMENTS, CLOUD USAGE INCREASED IN QUARTER.QUARTERLY LINKEDIN REVENUE INCREASED 21%.SAYS IN MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING SEGMENT, WINDOWS OEM, SURFACE BENEFITED FROM INCREASED DEMAND TO SUPPORT REMOTE WORK AND LEARN SCENARIOS IN QUARTER.SAYS IN MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING SEGMENT,WINDOWS OEM & SURFACE WAS OFFSET IN PART BY SUPPLY CHAIN CONSTRAINTS IN CHINA THAT IMPROVED LATE IN QUARTER.SAYS SEARCH WAS NEGATIVELY IMPACTED BY REDUCTIONS IN ADVERTISING SPEND, PARTICULARLY IN INDUSTRIES MOST IMPACTED BY COVID-19 IN QUARTER.SAYS EFFECTS OF COVID-19 MAY NOT BE FULLY REFLECTED IN FINANCIAL RESULTS UNTIL FUTURE PERIODS..

headline: Microsoft Announces Impact of Change In Accounting Estimate
description: July 22 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT - ABOUT $2.7 BILLION OF LOWER DEPRECIATION EXPENSE IN FY21,  WOULD BE AN IMPACT OF CHANGE IN ACCOUNTING ESTIMATE.MICROSOFT - ABOUT $900 MILLION OF LOWER DEPRECIATION EXPENSE IN Q1 WOULD BE AN IMPACT OF CHANGE IN ACCOUNTING ESTIMATE.MICROSOFT - INCREASE TO COMMERCIAL CLOUD GROSS MARGIN PERCENTAGE OF ABOUT 4 POINTS IN Q1 WOULD BE AN IMPACT OF CHANGE IN ACCOUNTING ESTIMATE.

headline: Microsoft Sees Q1 Productivity And Business Processes Revenue $11.65 Billion - $11.9 Billion
description: July 22 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT SEES Q1 PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES REVENUE $11.65 BILLION - $11.9 BILLION.MICROSOFT SEES Q1 MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING REVENUE $10.95 BILLION - $11.35 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q1 INTELLIGENT CLOUD REVENUE $12.55 BILLION TO $12.8 BILLION.MICROSOFT SEES Q1 COST OF REVENUE $10.75 BILLION - $10.95 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q1 OPERATING EXPENSES $10.7 BILLION TO $10.8 BILLION.MICROSOFT - EFFECTIVE START OF FY21, ESTIMATED USEFUL LIFE OF SERVER & NETWORK EQUIPMENT RISES FOR EXISTING ASSETS AS OF JUNE 30, & FUTURE PURCHASES.MICROSOFT - LOWER DEPRECIATION EXPENSE IN FY21 WOULD BE AN IMPACT OF CHANGE IN ACCOUNTING ESTIMATE.

headline: Microsoft Reports Qtrly Diluted Earnings Per Share Of $1.46
description: July 22 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT - QTRLY REVENUE WAS $38.0 BILLION AND INCREASED 13%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY  DILUTED EARNINGS PER SHARE WAS $1.46.MICROSOFT - THIS QUARTER OUR COMMERCIAL BOOKINGS WERE BETTER THAN EXPECTED.Q4 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $1.34, REVENUE VIEW $36.50 BILLION -- REFINITIV IBES DATA.MICROSOFT- QTRLY REVENUE IN MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING WAS $12.9 BILLION AND INCREASED 14% (UP 16% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).MICROSOFT - IN THE FOURTH QUARTER OF FISCAL YEAR 2020, SIMILAR BUSINESS TRENDS TO THE PREVIOUS QUARTER CONTINUED..MICROSOFT - GAAP RESULTS INCLUDE A $450 MILLION CHARGE FOR THE CLOSURE OF THE MICROSOFT STORE PHYSICAL LOCATIONS IN Q4 OF FISCAL YEAR 2020..MICROSOFT- QTRLY LINKEDIN REVENUE INCREASED 10% (UP 11% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY).MICROSOFT - IN Q4 2020, SIMILAR BUSINESS TRENDS TO PREVIOUS QUARTER CONTINUED DUE TO COVID-19.MICROSOFT - IN PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES AND INTELLIGENT CLOUD SEGMENTS, QTRLY CLOUD USAGE, DEMAND INCREASED.MICROSOFT - QTRLY SERVER PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 19% (UP 21% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY) DRIVEN BY AZURE REVENUE GROWTH OF 47%.MICROSOFT - XBOX CONTENT AND SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 65% (UP 68% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY) IN QUARTER.MICROSOFT - TRANSACTIONAL LICENSE PURCHASING CONTINUED TO SLOW, PARTICULARLY IN SMALL AND MEDIUM BUSINESSES IN QUARTER DUE TO COVID-19.MICROSOFT - LINKEDIN NEGATIVELY IMPACTED BY WEAK JOB MARKET AND REDUCTIONS IN ADVERTISING SPEND IN QUARTER DUE TO COVID-19.

headline: Microsoft to Acquire ZeniMax Media and Its Game Publisher Bethesda Softworks for $7.5 Bln In Cash
description: Sept 21 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT TO ACQUIRE ZENIMAX MEDIA AND ITS GAME PUBLISHER BETHESDA SOFTWORKS.MICROSOFT - UNDER TERMS OF AGREEMENT, MICROSOFT WILL ACQUIRE ZENIMAX MEDIA FOR $7.5 BILLION IN CASH.MICROSOFT - EXPECTS ACQUISITION TO HAVE MINIMAL IMPACT TO NON-GAAP OPERATING INCOME IN FISCAL YEARS 2021 AND 2022.MICROSOFT - WITH ADDITION OF BETHESDA, MICROSOFT WILL GROW FROM 15 TO 23 CREATIVE STUDIO TEAMS.MICROSOFT - INTENT TO BRING BETHESDA'S FUTURE GAMES INTO XBOX GAME PASS SAME DAY THEY LAUNCH ON XBOX OR PC.MICROSOFT - BETHESDA'S STRUCTURE AND LEADERSHIP WILL REMAIN IN PLACE.

headline: TomTom Sees Limited Q/Q Enterprise Sales Growth - Conf Call
description: Oct 14 (Reuters) - TomTom NV <TOM2.AS>::IN Q4, SEES SEQUENTIAL GROWTH IN AUTOMOTIVE OPERATIONAL REVENUE SIMILAR TO 2019 - CFO IN CONF CALL.SEES LIMITED INCREASE IN ENTERPRISE REVENUE IN Q4 COMPARED TO Q3 - CFO IN CONF CALL.IN Q4, SEES SEQUENTIAL DECREASE IN CONSUMER REVENUE SIMILAR TO 2019 - CFO IN CONF CALL.OVERALL DEAL ACTIVITY LEVEL IS STILL AT A GOOD LEVEL AND PROBABLY STRONGER THAN WHAT WE HAVE SEEN LAST YEAR - CEO IN CONF CALL.WE DON'T SEE A BIG IMPACT ON PRICING AS A RESULT OF GOING ONLINE - CEO IN CONF CALL.MARKET FOR SELF-DRIVING: I HAVE TO SAY THAT HAS DISAPPOINTED THIS YEAR - CEO IN CONF CALL.PRODUCTION OF HD MAPS: WE HAVE SLOWED THAT DOWN TO AN EXTENT, WE'RE NOT EXTENDING OUR COVERAGE AT THIS STAGE - CEO IN CONF CALL.HD MAPS: MAIN EFFORT NOW IS TO REDUCE COST OF PRODUCTION AND MAINTENANCE - CEO IN CONF CALL.ELECTRIC VEHICLES: ASSEMBLING SUITE OF TECHNOLOGIES TO ANTICIPATE DEMAND, REAL EFFECT ON OUR P&L NOW IS STILL LIMITED - CEO IN CONF CALL.ROBO-TAXIS: THERE'S NOT A CLEAR ROUTE FORWARD BUT WE HAVE OUR TOE INTO THAT MARKET - CEO IN CONF CALL.MICROSOFT PARTNERSHIP: MOVING INTO THE BING MAPPING PLATFORM NOW, THAT WILL DRIVE A LOT MORE TRAFFIC AND INTERACTION - CEO IN CONF CALL.

headline: Microsoft Sees Q2 Productivity And Business Processes Rev $12.75 To $13.0 Bln - Conf Call
description: Oct 27 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT SAYS TEAMS SOFTWARE HAS 115 MILLION DAILY ACTIVE USERS, UP FROM 75 MILLION IN APRIL - CONF CALL.MICROSOFT - SEES Q2 PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES REVENUE $12.75 TO $13.0 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q2 INTELLIGENT CLOUD REVENUE $13.55 BILLION TO $13.8 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q2 MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING REVENUE $13.2 BILLION TO $13.6 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q2 COST OF REVENUE COGS OF $13.75 TO $13.95 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q2 OPERATING EXPENSES $11.4 BILLION TO $11.5 BILLION.MICROSOFT - SEES Q2 GAMING REVENUE IN HIGH 20% RANGE.MICROSOFT - SEES INCREASE TO TOTAL REVENUE GROWTH OF ABOUT 1 POINT IN IN Q2 FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.MICROSOFT - SEES NO IMPACT TO COGS & INCREASE TO OPEX GROWTH OF ABOUT 1 POINT IN Q2 FROM FOREIGN CURRENCY IMPACT.MICROSOFT - SEES Q2 COMMERCIAL CLOUD GROSS MARGIN PERCENTAGE WILL INCREASE ABOUT 3 POINTS YEAR OVER YEAR.MICROSOFT - IN LINKEDIN, EXPECTS IMPROVED ADVERTISING MARKET, CONTINUED STRONG ENGAGEMENT ON PLATFORM TO DRIVE REVENUE GROWTH IN Q2 SIMILAR TO LAST QUARTER.MICROSOFT - EXPECTS NEGATIVE GROSS MARGIN IMPACT FROM CONSOLE SALES THIS QUARTER.MICROSOFT - Q2 XBOX CONTENT & SERVICES REVENUE SHOULD GROW IN LOW 20% RANGE, WITH STRONG ENGAGEMENT & CONTINUED MOMENTUM IN GAME PASS SUBSCRIBERS.

headline: Sap CEO Says Will Continue To Look Out For Smaller Acquisitions Where They Make Sense
description: Jan 15 (Reuters) - Sap <SAPG.DE>::CEO SAYS OUR RELATIONSHIP WITH MICROSOFT <<<MSFT.O>>> WILL ONLY GET CLOSER.CEO SAYS YOU CAN EXPECT MORE NEWS ON MICROSOFT, THEY WILL BE A KEY PART IN CLOUD TRANSITION KICK-OFF EVENT.CEO, ASKED ABOUT ACQUISITIONS, SAYS WE DON'T NEED TO BUY REVENUE.CEO SAYS WILL CONTINUE TO LOOK OUT FOR SMALLER ACQUISITIONS WHERE THEY MAKE SENSE.Further company coverage: <SAPG.DE>. (Reporting By Douglas Busvine). ((Sabine.Siebold@thomsonreuters.com;)).

headline: Microsoft Qtrly Revenue $43.1 Bln, Up 17%
description: Jan 26 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT - QTRLY REVENUE WAS $43.1 BILLION AND INCREASED 17%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY DILUTED EARNINGS PER SHARE WAS $2.03 AND INCREASED 34%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY SERVER PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 26% (UP 24% IN CONSTANT CURRENCY) DRIVEN BY AZURE REVENUE GROWTH OF 50%.MICROSOFT - ACCELERATING DEMAND FOR DIFFERENTIATED OFFERINGS DROVE COMMERCIAL CLOUD REVENUE TO $16.7 BILLION IN QUARTER, UP 34% YEAR OVER YEAR.MICROSOFT - QTRLY REVENUE IN INTELLIGENT CLOUD WAS $14.6 BILLION AND INCREASED 23%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY REVENUE IN PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES WAS $13.4 BILLION AND INCREASED 13%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY REVENUE IN MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING WAS $15.1 BILLION AND INCREASED 14%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY OFFICE COMMERCIAL PRODUCTS AND CLOUD SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 11%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY WINDOWS OEM REVENUE INCREASED 1%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY  LINKEDIN REVENUE INCREASED 23%.MICROSOFT - QTRLY XBOX CONTENT AND SERVICES REVENUE INCREASED 40%.Q2 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $1.64, REVENUE VIEW $40.18 BILLION -- REFINITIV IBES DATA.

headline: Microsoft Sees Q3 Productivity And Business Processes Revenue $13.35 Billion To $13.6 Billion

headline: Microsoft Accelerates Industry Cloud Strategy For Healthcare With The Acquisition Of Nuance
description: April 12 (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O>::MICROSOFT ACCELERATES INDUSTRY CLOUD STRATEGY FOR HEALTHCARE WITH THE ACQUISITION OF NUANCE.MICROSOFT - DEAL FOR $56.00 PER SHARE.MICROSOFT - AN ALL-CASH TRANSACTION VALUED AT $19.7 BILLION, INCLUSIVE OF NUANCE'S NET DEBT.MICROSOFT - TRANSACTION IS INTENDED TO CLOSE THIS CALENDAR YEAR.MICROSOFT - MARK BENJAMIN WILL REMAIN CEO OF NUANCE.MICROSOFT - EXPECTS ACQUISITION TO BE MINIMALLY DILUTIVE (LESS THAN 1 PERCENT) IN FISCAL YEAR 2022.MICROSOFT - ACQUISITION WILL NOT IMPACT COMPLETION OF ITS EXISTING SHARE REPURCHASE AUTHORIZATION.MICROSOFT - TRANSACTION HAS BEEN UNANIMOUSLY APPROVED BY BOARDS OF DIRECTORS OF BOTH NUANCE AND MICROSOFT.MICROSOFT - EXPECTS ACQUISITION TO BE ACCRETIVE IN FISCAL YEAR 2023 TO NON-GAAP EARNINGS PER SHARE.

headline: Activision Blizzard Announces First Quarter 2023 Financial Results
description: April 26 (Reuters) - Activision Blizzard Inc <ATVI.O>::ACTIVISION BLIZZARD ANNOUNCES FIRST QUARTER 2023 FINANCIAL RESULTS.Q1 GAAP OPERATING INCOME GREW APPROXIMATELY 70% YEAR-OVER-YEAR.Q1 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $0.52, REVENUE VIEW $1.79 BILLION -- REFINITIV IBES DATA.REMAIN CONFIDENT THAT OUR DEAL WITH MICROSOFT BENEFITS COMPETITION, CONSUMERS, AND JOB CREATION IN MARKETS AROUND WORLD.ACTIVISION SEGMENT REVENUE GREW 28% YEAR-OVER-YEAR IN THE FIRST QUARTER."CONSIDERS THAT CMA'S DECISION IS DISPROPORTIONATE, IRRATIONAL AND INCONSISTENT WITH EVIDENCE".BLIZZARD SEGMENT REVENUE INCREASED 62% YEAR-OVER-YEAR IN THE FIRST QUARTER.PARTIES CONTINUE TO FULLY ENGAGE WITH OTHER REGULATORS REVIEWING MICROSOFT DEAL TO OBTAIN ANY REQUIRED REGULATORY APPROVALS.FOR QUARTER ENDED MARCH 31, 2023, ACTIVISION BLIZZARD'S NET BOOKINGS WERE $1.86 BILLION, AS COMPARED WITH $1.48 BILLION FOR Q1 OF 2022.WILL WORK  WITH MICROSOFT TO REVERSE CMA'S REPORT ON APPEAL.FOR THE QUARTER ENDED MARCH 31, 2023, OVERALL ACTIVISION BLIZZARD MONTHLY ACTIVE USERS WERE 368 MILLION.CONTINUE TO EXPECT AT LEAST HIGH-TEENS YEAR-OVER-YEAR GROWTH FOR GAAP REVENUE IN 2023.SEES AT LEAST HIGH-SINGLE DIGIT YEAR-OVER-YEAR GROWTH IN NET BOOKINGS AND TOTAL SEGMENT OPERATING INCOME FOR YEAR.WE EXPECT ACTIVISION BLIZZARD Q2 GAAP REVENUE TO GROW AT LEAST 10%.ACTIVISION BLIZZARD ENDED QUARTER WITH A NET CASH POSITION OF APPROXIMATELY $8.9 BILLION.CASH AND SHORT-TERM INVESTMENTS AT END OF Q1 STOOD AT $12.6 BILLION.
